subject: Re: [junit] Re: Junit reporting
msgSnippet: ... In fact, it allows the Ant build to continue when the junit task fails, as far as I know. Cheers, Ilja
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger schrieb:

> > You could use junit ant task properties haltonfailure="off" and
> > haltonerror="off". Example:
> >
> > <junit fork="yes" printsummary="on" haltonfailure="off"
> > haltonerror="off" errorproperty="test.errors"
> > failureproperty="test.errors">
> > ...
> > </junit>
>
> I am not an Ant expert, but I don't believe that will work. It allows a
> test suite to continue executing if a test fails, but each test will
> still stop executing after the first assertion failure.

In fact, it allows the Ant build to continue when the junit task fails,
as far as I know.

Cheers, Ilja
